featured.text: She drew on her memories from childhood and expanded upon them using her imagination so that the characters developed a life of their own.
A lover of tea since her childhood in Portugal, she brought tea-drinking to the English royal court and set a trend for the beverage in the seventeenth century.
E. Eddie My childhood memory of a polar bear pacing back and forth in a very small space in a zoo keeps haunting me.
She was born in Philadelphia and sang in church choirs during her childhood.
As the years have passed by, many of my childhood memories are already ______; I can no longer recall clearly what happened back then.

other.text: She wrote a story based on the life of a girl she knew in childhood who had prayed to God for blue eyes.
For example, the flavors people with taste-word synesthesia experience are usually childhood flavors, such as chocolate or strawberries.

definition.zh_def: 童年，指一個人從出生到青少年時期的生活階段。
definition.en_def: The period of time when a person is a child, typically considered to be from birth to adolescence.
definition.example: She often reminisces about the carefree days of her childhood.
